text: Paul F. Markham (May 22, 1930 â€“ July 13, 2019) was an American attorney. He was the United States Attorney for the District of Massachusetts from 1966 to 1969. Markham was born in Boston, Massachusetts. Markham was a key figure in the Chappaquiddick incident as he was with Senator Ted Kennedy during the incident. He played a key defense in Kennedy's favor. Markham died on July 13, 2019 in Peabody, Massachusetts at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Lawyers from Boston Category:Politicians from Boston Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Paul F. Markham
